a.m. to 4:00 p.m. on Frida=\r\ny.</p>=0D=0A<h2>Mail</h2>=0D=0A<p>=0D=0A<table border=3D\"0\">=0D=0A<tbody>=\r\n=0D=0A<tr>=0D=0A<td>The Beekman School</td>=0D=0A</tr>=0D=0A<tr>=0D=0A<td>2=\r\n20 East member has an e-mail address co=\r\nnsisting of first name and last initial, followed by beekmanschool.org. For=\r\n example, George Higgins' email address is <a href=3D\"mailto:georgeh@beekma=\r\nnschool.org\">georgeh@beekmanschool.org</a>. <br /><br />A full listing of t=\r\nhe faculty and their e-mails are located on&nbsp;the&nbsp;<a href=3D\"http:/=\r\n/www.beekmanschool.org/pageview.aspx?id=3D22334\">Faculty</a> page.</p>=0D=\r\n=0A<h2>Getting to&nbsp;Beekman</h2>=0D=0A<p>The Beekman School is located a=\r\nt 220 East 50th Street, between 2nd and 3rd Avenues. As you walk down 50th =\r\nStreet, Beekman is the&nbsp;townhouse with a fire escape.</p>=0D=0A<h2>By S=\r\nubway</h2>=0D=0A<p>You can take the&nbsp;<img colspan=3D\"2\" rowspan=3D\"1\"  width=3D\"680\"  id=3D\"c=\r\n_394338\" ><div class=3D\"div1\"><div class=3D\"div2\"><h6>About Beekman&nbsp;::=\r\n Our Mission</h6></div></div></td><td colspan=3D\"1\" rowspan=3D\"6\"  width=3D=\r\n\"20\"  id=3D\"c_394340\" ></td></tr><tr class=3D\"r2\" id=3D\"r2_22243\"><td colsp=\r\nan=3D\"2\" rowspan=3D\"1\"  width=3D\"680\"  align=3D\"left\"  id=3D\"c_394341\" ><di=\r\nv class=3D\"div1\"><div class=3D\"div2\"><p align=3D\"left\">The Beekman School m=\r\nission is to give students the tools and the confidence to control their ow=\r\nn destiny, to become life-long learners, and to give back to their communit=\r\ny.</p>=0D=0A<p align=3D\"left\">We are&nbsp;a private high school for grades =\r\n9 through 12 that delivers a traditional college preparatory program in a n=\r\non-traditional manner. Beekman is tailored to nurture the development of ea=\r\nch individual student. To that end, we provide flexible scheduling, rolling=\r\n admissions, classes of no more than ten students, and the option of privat=\r\ne instruction and customized courses.</p>=0D=0A<p align=3D\"left\">Despite ou=\r\nr size, we have a diverse student body with young men and women from all wa=\r\nlks of life and all parts of the world.&nbsp;Beekman students&nbsp;play an =\r\nactive role in shaping their education, instilling a sense of commitment an=\r\nd responsibility. They interact on a daily basis with an exceptional facult=\r\ny that they come to know on a first-name basis. And when they graduate, the=\r\ny not only leave with a solid academic foundation, but with a keen&nbsp;sen=\r\nse of what lies ahead.</p></div></div></td></tr><tr class=3D\"r3\" colspan=3D\"2\" rowspan=3D\"1\"  width=3D\"680\"  id=3D\"c=\r\n_394351\" ><div class=3D\"div1\"><div class=3D\"div2\"><h6>About Beekman&nbsp;::=\r\n History</h6></div></div></td><td colspan=3D\"1\" rowspan=3D\"6\"  width=3D\"20\"=\r\n  id=3D\"c_394353\" ></td></tr><tr class=3D\"r2\" id=3D\"r2_22244\"><td colspan=\r\n=3D\"2\" rowspan=3D\"1\"  width=3D\"680\"  align=3D\"left\"  id=3D\"c_394354\" ><div =\r\nclass=3D\"div1\"><div class=3D\"div2\"><p><img style=3D\"float: right; margin: 0=\r\npx 10px; border: 0px;\" src=3D\"http://www.centralpt.com/customer/image_galle=\r\nry/358/special_earlychemistrylab.jpg\" alt=3D\"\" width=3D\"156\" height=3D\"228\"=\r\n /> The Beekman School of today continues a rich tradition of academic exce=\r\nllence that began more than 80 years ago.&nbsp;From its beginnings as The T=\r\nutoring School of New York, Beekman has remained true to the vision of its =\r\nfounder, George Matthew. His objective was simple and direct &ndash; to cre=\r\nate a school where the full potential of every student can be realized with=\r\nin the framework of a traditional high school education.</p>=0D=0A<p>An ess=\r\nential component of Mr. Matthew&rsquo;s vision was the need for an intimate=\r\n environment, where a quality education can be delivered in a highly-focuse=\r\nd manner. Our&nbsp;unique townhouse setting provides this&nbsp;key componen=\r\nt. It assures small class sizes, allows greater student-teacher interaction=\r\n, and supports a&nbsp;collegial atmosphere that produces extraordinary resu=\r\nlts.</p>=0D=0A<p>Today, Beekman offers a fully comprehensive college-prep c=\r\nurriculum. We combine classroom-style education with one-on-one instruction=\r\n that is still offered through The Tutoring School component of our school.=\r\n The vision of our founder lives on. While George Matthew may marvel at the=\r\n Beekman School of the 21st century with its high-tech innovations, he woul=\r\nd surely recognize its spirit as his own.</p>=0D=0A<p><img style=3D\"margin-=\r\ntop: 10px; margin-bottom: 10px; vertical-align: text-bottom;\" src=3D\"http:/=\r\n/www.centralpt.com/customer/image_gallery/358/class_computer_lab.JPG\" alt=\r\n=3D\"\" ></td><=\r\n/tr><tr class=3D\"r1\" id=3D\"r1_22270\"><td colspan=3D\"1\" rowspan=3D\"6\"  width=\r\n=3D\"20\"  id=3D\"c_394652\" ></td><td colspan=3D\"2\" rowspan=3D\"1\"  width=3D\"68=\r\n0\"  id=3D\"c_394653\" ><div class=3D\"div1\"><div class=3D\"div2\"><h6>About Beek=\r\nman&nbsp;:: The Beekman Difference</h6></div></div></td><td colspan=3D\"1\" r=\r\nowspan=3D\"6\"  width=3D\"20\"  id=3D\"c_394655\" ></td></tr><tr class=3D\"r2\" id=\r\n=3D\"r2_22270\"><td colspan=3D\"2\" rowspan=3D\"1\"  width=3D\"680\"  align=3D\"left=\r\n\"  id=3D\"c_394656\" ><div class=3D\"div1\"><div class=3D\"div2\"><h3><span style=\r\n=3D\"color: #000000;\">There are many reasons why Beekman stands apart from o=\r\nther private high schools.</span></h3>=0D=0A<h3><span style=3D\"color: #0000=\r\n00;\">Here are just a few of them.</span></h3>=0D=0A<p>=0D=0A<h3>Personalize=\r\nd Education</h3>=0D=0A<p>The majority of our incoming students seek a tradi=\r\ntional 4-year education; however, Beekman also provides tailored programs t=\r\nhat allow students to:</p>=0D=0A<ul>=0D=0A<li>=0D=0A<div>Accelerate coursew=\r\nork for an early graduation</div>=0D=0A</li>=0D=0A<li>=0D=0A<div>Extend gra=\r\nduation an extra semester or year</div>=0D=0A</li>=0D=0A<li>=0D=0A<div>Cust=\r\nomize their schedules, such as morning or afternoon-only classes, and reduc=\r\ned course loads</div>=0D=0A</li>=0D=0A</ul>=0D=0A<hr />=0D=0A<h3>Extensive =\r\nCurriculum</h3>=0D=0A<p>The Beekman curriculum is extremely comprehensive, =\r\noffering a vast array of standard academic courses and numerous interesting=\r\n electives. In addition to providing all of the traditional college-prep co=\r\nurses, we offer:</p>=0D=0A<ul>=0D=0A<li>=0D=0A<div>University-level courses=\r\n in math, science, humanities, and English</div>=0D=0A</li>=0D=0A<li>=0D=0A=\r\n<div>A wide range of electives, from Astronomy to Web Design</div>=0D=0A</l=\r\ni>=0D=0A<li>=0D=0A<div>Student-specific courses for almost any topic throug=\r\nh The Tutoring School, our on-site individualized learning program</div>=0D=\r\n=0A</li>=0D=0A<li>=0D=0A<div>Off-site tutoring for course credit</div>=0D=\r\n=0A</li>=0D=0A</ul>=0D=0A<hr />=0D=0A<h3>Individual Attention</h3>=0D=0A<p>=\r\nBeekman&rsquo;s intimate setting is ideal for focusing attention on the nee=\r\nds of each student.</p>=0D=0A<ul>=0D=0A<li>An average class size of 8 stude=\r\nnts (maximum of 10) provides more opportunities to ask questions, debate al=\r\nternatives, and discuss solutions</li>=0D=0A<li>Beekman teachers closely mo=\r\nnitor individual performance and provide immediate feedback</li>=0D=0A<li>T=\r\neacher-supervised study halls provide a focused area for reading, studying,=\r\n and completing homework assignments</li>=0D=0A<li>Concentrated help in spe=\r\ncific subject areas is available through one-on-one tutoring</li>=0D=0A</ul=\r\n>=0D=0A<hr />=0D=0A<h3>Exceptional Faculty</h3>=0D=0A<p>The Beekman faculty=\r\n is highly regarded for its skills in motivating each student, creating new=\r\n paths for learning, and building student confidence.</p>=0D=0A<ul>=0D=0A<l=\r\ni>The faculty meets regularly as a group to assess individual student progr=\r\ness and to create coordinated approaches for enhancing student development<=\r\n/li>=0D=0A<li>Teachers are on a first-name basis with students to encourage=\r\n informal communication, share experiences, and foster an environment for m=\r\nentoring and support</li>=0D=0A<li>Teachers maintain close ties with parent=\r\ns, providing ongoing updates by phone, email, regularly scheduled written r=\r\neports, and on-site conferences when needed</li>=0D=0A</ul>=0D=0A<hr />=0D=\r\n=0A<h3>Extraordinary Results</h3>=0D=0A<p>Our mission is to give students t=\r\nhe confidence to control their own destiny, to become life-long learners, a=\r\nnd to give back to their community and our world.</p>=0D=0A<ul>=0D=0A<li>Al=\r\nl students take advantage of our personalized and comprehensive college pla=\r\ncement that guides students and parents through the selection and applicati=\r\non process</li>=0D=0A<li>Approximately 98% of Beekman graduates go on to co=\r\nllege</li>=0D=0A<li>A Beekman education is an incredibly enriching experien=\r\nce&nbsp;&nbsp;</li>=0D=0A</ul>=0D=0A<hr />=0D=0A<h3>Delighted Parents and S=\r\ntudents</h3>=0D=0A<p>It seems that almost daily we hear glowing compliments=\r\n about our school from parents, students, or alumni. Here are just some of =\r\nthe comments we&rsquo;ve received:</p>=0D=0A<blockquote>=0D=0A<h4><span sty=\r\nle=3D\"color: #000000;\">From Parents:</span></h4>=0D=0A</blockquote>=0D=0A<b=\r\nlockquote>=0D=0A<p><em>&ldquo;Beekman provided instruction at the highest i=\r\nntellectual level.&rdquo;</em></p>=0D=0A<p><em>&ldquo;There is a great sens=\r\ne of friendship and support among the students for one another, and especia=\r\nlly for the marvelous teachers.&rdquo;</em></p>=0D=0A<p><em>&ldquo;I would =\r\nrecommend Beekman to everyone and anyone who really wants their child to lo=\r\nve learning.&rdquo;</em></p>=0D=0A<p><em>&ldquo;Students are treated with r=\r\nespect, as are parents.&rdquo;</em></p>=0D=0A<p><em>&ldquo;The atmosphere a=\r\nt the school is lively, and the students both talented and creative.&rdquo;=\r\n</em></p>=0D=0A<p><em>&ldquo;Whatever students&rsquo; goals or aptitudes ar=\r\ne, they are met. students.&rdquo;</em></p>=0D=0A<p><em>&ldquo;I learned to expand myself a=\r\nnd be confident in my interests.&rdquo;</em></p>=0D=0A<p><em>&ldquo;I miss =\r\nBeekman.&rdquo;</em></p>=0D=0A</blockquote>=0D=0A</p></div></div></td></tr>=\r\n<tr class=3D\"r3\" id=3D\"r3_22270\"><td colspan=3D\"2\" rowspan=3D\"1\"  width=3D\"=\r\n680\"  id=3D\"c_394658\" East Side Manhattan townhous=\r\ne&nbsp;that has been converted to a modern learning environment. Great care=\r\n has been taken to retain the warm feeling inherent in&nbsp;the original&nb=\r\nsp;building&nbsp;while providing the latest&nbsp;tools for a first-class ed=\r\nucational experience.</p>=0D=0A<p>Inside you will find:</p>=0D=0A<ul>=0D=0A=\r\n<li>Eight classrooms</li>=0D=0A<li>SMART Board technology</li>=0D=0A<li>Tea=\r\nching carrels for private instruction</li>=0D=0A<li>A study hall</li>=0D=0A=\r\n<li>A small library</li>=0D=0A<li>A state-of-the-art laboratory for biology=\r\n, chemistry, and physics</li>=0D=0A<li>A computer lab with Apple Computers<=\r\n/li>=0D=0A<li>A beautifully landscaped garden</li>=0D=0A</ul>=0D=0A<h2><br =\r\n/>Surrounded by Diverse Culture</h2>=0D=0A<p>A Beekman education is enhance=\r\nd by our location in New York City. Our quiet neighborhood is part of the d=\r\niverse culture of East Side Manhattan and is within walking distance of maj=\r\nor landmarks such as the United Nations, Grand Central Terminal, St. Patric=\r\nk's Cathedral, and Rockefeller Center. New York's major art museums, includ=\r\ning MoMa, The Metropolitan Museum of Art, and the city's famous Museum Mile=\r\n, are all just a short trip away.</p>=0D=0A<p class=3D\"MsoNormal\" With our small=\r\n class sizes, students have&nbsp;more&nbsp;opportunities to participate in =\r\nclass discussions, share experiences, and discover common interests. It doe=\r\nsn't take long to be readily accepted at&nbsp;Beekman.&nbsp;</p>=0D=0A<p st=\r\nyle=3D\"MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt\">Students are also on a first-name basis with th=\r\neir instructors from day one. This makes&nbsp;the classroom less formal and=\r\n encourages greater student participation. The net result is camaraderie wi=\r\nthin the Beekman student body that is palpable. You feel it in the hallways=\r\n between classes, see it in the student lounge at lunchtime, and hear it in=\r\n the outdoor garden in the spring or fall when the strains of an&nbsp;ad ho=\r\nc&nbsp;guitar group float through the air.</p>=0D=0A<h2>Student Schedules</=\r\nh2>=0D=0A<p>Each student's schedule reflects his or her individual needs. T=\r\nhe school day begins at 8:45 a.m. and continues until 3:50 p.m. When possib=\r\nle, students who have a long distance to commute can be scheduled to begin =\r\nclasses at 9:30 or 10:15. Students with professional programs outside of sc=\r\nhool can have classes arranged for mornings or afternoons. Supervised study=\r\n halls and lunch periods are scheduled throughout the day on a staggered ba=\r\nsis.</p>=0D=0A<h2>Enrollment</h2>=0D=0A<p>Beekman begins the fall term of e=\r\nach school year with approximately 70 students. However, our rolling admiss=\r\nions policy means that the school adds members to the student body until it=\r\n reaches its maximum enrollment of 85 students.</p>=0D=0A<p>Enrollment is g=\r\nenerally evenly divided between boys and girls, with many nationalities and=\r\n backgrounds represented. All students are from the immediate tri-state are=\r\na of New Jersey, Connecticut, New York and its suburbs. &nbsp;</p>=0D=0A<h2=\r\n>The Beekman Code of Conduct</h2>=0D=0A<p>For approximately seven hours eac=\r\nh day, Beekman becomes a second home for our students and teachers. Our sma=\r\nll, intimate setting makes it particularly important to respect the rights =\r\nof others and maintain an environment conducive to learning.</p>=0D=0A<p>Ov=\r\ner the years, The Beekman School code of behavior has been shaped by our st=\r\nudents and teachers. Beekman students are encouraged to respect their schoo=\r\nl and to treat their fellow students with the same respect and understandin=\r\ng they would want for themselves. Offensive behavior is untenable and is no=\r\nt tolerated.</p>=0D=0A<h5>Extracurricular Activities</h5></div></div></td><=\r\n/tr><tr class=3D\"r3\" id=3D\"r3_24165\"><td colspan=3D\"2\" rowspan=3D\"1\"  width=\r\n=3D\"680\"  id=3D\"c_414938\" ><table class=3D\"shaded\"><tr><td><h2>The Yearbook=\r\n and Literary Magazine</h2>=0D=0A<blockquote>=0D=0A<p>Every year, the schoo=\r\nl produces a yearbook and a literary magazine. All students are welcome to =\r\njoin the yearbook staff and all students are encouraged to contribute to th=\r\ne literary magazine.</p>=0D=0A</blockquote>=0D=0A<h2>School Clubs</h2>=0D=\r\n=0A<blockquote>=0D=0A<p>Given the wide range of interests among students an=\r\nd staff, after-school activities vary from year to year. After-school activ=\r\nities include or have included a drama club, film club, music exploration c=\r\nlub, humanities lecture series, philosophy club, international students clu=\r\nb, and photography club. Underclassmen can also take part in community volu=\r\nnteer programs if the desire and maturity are present. The school maintains=\r\n a list of possible organizations.</p>=0D=0A</blockquote>=0D=0A<h2>New York=\r\n City Day Trips</h2>=0D=0A<blockquote>=0D=0A<p>The school's Manhattan locat=\r\nion gives it the opportunity to use New York City and its immediate environ=\r\ns as an extension of the classroom. Students are invited to attend plays, f=\r\nilms, operas, and dance performances, and visit the city's various museums,=\r\n special exhibitions, historical sites, and other points of interest in and=\r\n around Manhattan and as far away as Philadelphia.</p>=0D=0A</blockquote>=\r\n=0D=0A<h2>Annual Trips outside of New York</h2>=0D=0A<blockquote>=0D=0A<p>I=\r\nn addition to day trips, each year the school plans at least one week-long =\r\ntrip outside of New York. We have been to Washington, D.C., toured the Deep=\r\n South, and visited Costa Rica. During spring break, the school plans a tri=\r\np to the Galapagos Islands or Europe. Cities visited include Paris, Rome, V=\r\nenice, Vienna, Budapest, and London. Seniors can plan a senior trip in Febr=\r\nuary. In the past, seniors have visited Key West, the Bahamas, Mexico, and =\r\nTobago.</p>=0D=0A</blockquote></td></tr></table></td></tr><tr class=3D\"r4\" =\r\nid=3D\"r4_24165\"><td colspan=3D\"1\" rowspan=3D\"1\"  width=3D\"480\"  id=3D\"c_414=\r\n939\" ></td><td colspan=3D\"1\" rowspan=3D\"1\"  width=3D\"200\"  id=3D\"c_414940\" =\r\n></td></tr><tr class=3D\"r5\" id=3D\"r5_24165\"><td Please return it to us within the first week your child is in attendance =\r\nat The Beekman School.</p>=0D=0A<p>&nbsp;</p>=0D=0A<p><span style=3D\"text-d=\r\necoration: underline;\">How can I get a copy of my official transcript?</spa=\r\nn><br /><br />Send an email to <a href=3D\"mailto:kimk@beekmanschool.org\">mi=\r\nkag@beekmanschool.org</a> with the following information:<br /><br />Name (=\r\nat time of graduation or withdrawal)<br />Year of graduation or withdrawal<=\r\nbr />Current phone number<br />Name and address of school(s) where transcri=\r\npt should be sent.<br /><br />Note: Official copies can only be sent direct=\r\nly to a school/university. I=\r\nf you would like an unofficial copy please provide us with your current add=\r\nress.</p>=0D=0A<p>&nbsp;</p>=0D=0A<p><span style=3D\"text-decoration: underl=\r\nine;\">My child owes community service hours. How can he/she fulfill them?</=\r\nspan></p>=0D=0A<p>Here is a document with <a href=3D\"http://centralpt.com/u=\r\npload/358/14197_community_service_suggestions.pdf\" target=3D\"_blank\">venues=\r\n our students have served</a> in the past. We will accept the hours as long=\r\n as they are through a non-profit organization and your student is not comp=\r\nensated. In order to be processed, we need to receive a letter on letterhea=\r\nd from the supervisor, delineating the nature of the work performed and how=\r\n many hours were served.</p>=0D=0A<p>&nbsp;</p>=0D=0A<p><span style=3D\"text=\r\n-decoration: underline;\">My student lost his/her metrocard. What do we do?<=\r\n/span></p>=0D=0A<p>The school receives a limited number of student metrocar=\r\nds from the Office of Pupil Transportation each semester. Occasionally we h=\r\nave extras, but we cannot guarantee that more than one metrocard will be av=\r\nailable per student per semester. Ask the attendance supervisor for further=\r\n information, or go to the <a href=3D\"http://schools.nyc.gov/Offices/Transp=\r\nortation/ServicesandEligibility/StudentMetroCards/default.htm\">DOE website<=\r\n/a>.</p></div></div></td></tr></table></td></tr><tr><td colspan=3D\"20\" nowr=\r\nap><p><table border=3D\"0\" width=3D\"900\"><tbody><tr><td style=3D\"width: 40%\"=\r\n></td><td colspan=3D\"2\" rowspan=3D\"1\"  width=3D\"680\"  id=3D\"c_39424=\r\n4\" ><div class=3D\"div1\"><div class=3D\"div2\"><h6>Academics&nbsp;::&nbsp;Goal=\r\ns</h6></div></div></td><td colspan=3D\"1\" rowspan=3D\"6\"  width=3D\"20\"  id=3D=\r\n\"c_394246\" ></td></tr><tr class=3D\"r2\" id=3D\"r2_22235\"><td colspan=3D\"2\" ro=\r\nwspan=3D\"1\"  width=3D\"680\"  align=3D\"left\"  id=3D\"c_394247\" ><div class=3D\"=\r\ndiv1\"><div class=3D\"div2\"><p>We at The Beekman School have a keen interest =\r\nin developing students&rsquo; independent and creative thought and&nbsp;wil=\r\nlingness to accept intellectual risks and challenges, as well as the format=\r\nion of superior work habits and cooperative, positive approaches to learnin=\r\ng. While these attributes cannot always be precisely measured and adjusted,=\r\n we prize them and work energetically to foster their development. There is=\r\n no doubt that the development of these skills brings with them not only a =\r\nsense of academic achievement but also a feeling of pride and satisfaction.=\r\n</p>=0D=0A<h2>Assessment</h2>=0D=0A<p>A variety of measures including proje=\r\ncts, essays, presentations, portfolios, homework assignments, quizzes, and =\r\ntests are used to teach students and assess their progress.<br />All teache=\r\nrs announce dates of tests, due dates of papers and major projects in advan=\r\nce. Students should talk to their teachers ahead of time if they need an ex=\r\ntension on a project or if they need to re-schedule an exam. Generally, if =\r\na student has three major exams on one day, re-scheduling one of these exam=\r\ns may be possible, as long as it is done in advance. Re-scheduling an exam =\r\non the day of that exam is not permitted.</p>=0D=0A<h2>Homework Policy</h2>=\r\n=0D=0A<p>Students should expect to have homework assigned every day in all =\r\nsubjects. Weekend assignments are given at the discretion of individual tea=\r\nchers. Students should see their teachers, study hall supervisor, or adviso=\r\nr if they need help organizing and completing their work in a reasonable am=\r\nount of time. Daily homework assignments should take 30-45 minutes per clas=\r\ns to complete for freshmen and sophomores and 45 minutes per class for juni=\r\nors and seniors.</p>=0D=0A<p>Homework assignments are posted daily on the s=\r\nchool website. Up to date homework information is provided for both current=\r\n and past assignments. This enables students who are absent or misplace an =\r\nassignment to keep pace with the work, and enables parents to monitor homew=\r\nork assignments, as needed. Homework assignments can be accessed using the =\r\nCurrent Students link at the bottom of each page.</p>=0D=0A<h2>Study Hall</=\r\nh2>=0D=0A<p>It is important for students to develop disciplined homework an=\r\nd study habits. For this reason, there is a teacher-supervised study hall h=\r\neld every period from 8:45 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. Students may be assigned to a =\r\nstudy hall if their academic circumstances warrant it or if a parent reques=\r\nts it. Attendance is taken during study hall for all students whose presenc=\r\ne is required. Missing a regular study hall will result in a one-hour after=\r\n-school detention.</p></div></div></td></tr><tr class=3D\"r3\" id=3D\"r3_22235=\r\n\"><td colspan=3D\"2\" rowspan=3D\"1\" colspan=3D\"2\" rowspan=3D\"1\"  width=3D\"680\"  id=3D\"c=\r\n_394268\" ><div class=3D\"div1\"><div class=3D\"div2\"><h6><a name=3D\"top\" title=\r\n=3D\"top\"></a>Academics&nbsp;:: Curriculum Guide</h6></div></div></td><td co=\r\nlspan=3D\"1\" rowspan=3D\"6\"  width=3D\"20\"  id=3D\"c_394270\" ></td></tr><tr cla=\r\nss=3D\"r2\" id=3D\"r2_22237\"><td colspan=3D\"2\" rowspan=3D\"1\"  width=3D\"680\"  a=\r\nlign=3D\"left\"  id=3D\"c_394271\" ><div class=3D\"div1\"><div class=3D\"div2\"><h2=\r\n>The Beekman Approach to Learning </h2><p>We at The Beekman School have a k=\r\neen interest in developing students&rsquo; independent and creative thought=\r\n, willingness to take intellectual risks and accept challenges, formation o=\r\nf superior work habits and cooperative, positive approaches to learning. Wh=\r\nile these attributes cannot always be precisely measured and adjusted, we p=\r\nrize them and work energetically to foster their development. There is no d=\r\noubt that the development of these skills brings with them not only a sense=\r\n of academic achievement, but also a feeling of pride and satisfaction.</p>=\r\n<ul><li><a href=3D\"/pageview.aspx?id=3D22237#1\">High School Graduation Requ=\r\nirements</a></li><li><a href=3D\"/pageview.aspx?id=3D22237#2\">Class Length</=\r\na></li><li><a href=3D\"/pageview.aspx?id=3D22237#3\">College Board Testing</a=\r\n></li><li><a href=3D\"/pageview.aspx?id=3D22237#4\">Course Planning</a></li><=\r\nli><a href=3D\"/pageview.aspx?id=3D22237#5\">Evaluation Reports</a></li><li><=\r\na href=3D\"/pageview.aspx?id=3D22237#6\">Grades and Honor Roll</a></li><li><a=\r\n href=3D\"/pageview.aspx?id=3D22237#7\">Academic Policies and Procedures</a><=\r\n/li><li><a href=3D\"/pageview.aspx?id=3D22237#8\">College Guidance</a></li><l=\r\ni><a href=3D\"/pageview.aspx?id=3D22237#9\">Clubs, Activities, and Class Trip=\r\ns</a></li></ul><p>&nbsp;</p></div></div></td></tr><tr class=3D\"r3\" id=3D\"r3=\r\n_22237\"><td colspan=3D\"2\" rowspan=3D\"1\"  width=3D\"680\"  id=3D\"c_394273\" ><t=\r\nable class=3D\"shaded\"><tr><td><h3><a title=3D\"1\" name=3D\"1\"></a>High School=\r\n Graduation Requirements</h3>=0D=0A<p>To receive a diploma, a student must =\r\nearn at least 20 units of credit. One credit is given for each full-year co=\r\nurse completed. The following courses must be completed in order to earn a =\r\nBeekman School diploma:</p>=0D=0A<p>1. Four years of English</p>=0D=0A<p>2.=\r\n Four years of history/social sciences, including at least:</p>=0D=0A<ul>=\r\n=0D=0A<li>One year of World History</li>=0D=0A<li>One year of United States=\r\n History</li>=0D=0A<li>One semester of U. S. Government</li>=0D=0A<li>One s=\r\nemester of Economics</li>=0D=0A</ul>=0D=0A<p>3. Three years of mathematics,=\r\n including:</p>=0D=0A<ul>=0D=0A<li>One year of Algebra</li>=0D=0A<li>One ye=\r\nar of Geometry </li>=0D=0A</ul>=0D=0A<p>4. Three years of science, includin=\r\ng: One year that consists of at least 20 hours of laboratory time</p>=0D=0A=\r\n<p>5. Two years of the same foreign language</p>=0D=0A<p>6. One year of vis=\r\nual arts, music, dance or theatre</p>=0D=0A<p>7. One semester of health</p>=\r\n=0D=0A<p>8. One semester of computer technology</p>=0D=0A<p>9. Electives: T=\r\nwo years (or four semesters)</p>=0D=0A<p>Physical Education is mandatory fo=\r\nr all full-time Beekman School and Tutoring School students. These credits =\r\nare not included in the required 20 units.</p>=0D=0A<p>In addition to the c=\r\nourse requirements, the following five Regents exams must be passed with a =\r\nminimum score of 65% in order to receive a Beekman School diploma:&nbsp;</p=\r\n>=0D=0A<ol>=0D=0A<li>Comprehensive English</li>=0D=0A<li>Global History &am=\r\np; Geography</li>=0D=0A<li>United States History &amp; Government</li>=0D=\r\n=0A<li>Mathematics A or Sequential Mathematics I and Sequential Mathematics=\r\n II</li>=0D=0A<li>Living Environment (Science)</li>=0D=0A</ol>=0D=0A<p>It i=\r\ns recommended that each student in grades 9-12 take 6 or 7 courses each sem=\r\nester. The typical course load is English, history, math, science, foreign =\r\nlanguage, and one art, elective, or technology course.</p>=0D=0A<p style=3D=\r\n\"text-align: center;\"><strong><em><a href=3D\"/pageview.aspx?id=3D22237#top\"=\r\n><font size=3D\"1\">back to top</font></a></em></strong></p>=0D=0A<hr />=0D=\r\n=0A<h3><a title=3D\"2\" name=3D\"2\"></a>Class Length</h3>=0D=0A<p>Class period=\r\ns are 45- 50 minutes in length. There are some double blocks for art and ot=\r\nher electives; these classes are taught twice a week, usually from 3:00-4:3=\r\n0 p.m.</p>=0D=0A<p><strong><em>=0D=0A<p align=3D\"center\"><strong><em><a hre=\r\nf=3D\"/pageview.aspx?id=3D22237#top\"><font size=3D\"1\">back to top</font></a>=\r\n</em></strong></p>=0D=0A</em></strong></p>=0D=0A<hr />=0D=0A<h3><a title=3D=\r\n\"3\" name=3D\"3\"></a>College Board Testing</h3>=0D=0A<p>Each year students pr=\r\nepare for and take a number of College Board standardized examinations:</p>=\r\n=0D=0A<ol>=0D=0A<li>PSAT (grade10, optional, and grade 11)</li>=0D=0A<li>SA=\r\nT I Reasoning test (May of grade 11 &amp; November of grade 12)</li>=0D=0A<=\r\nli>SAT II Subject Tests at the end of specific courses (grades 11 &amp; 12)=\r\n</li>=0D=0A<li>Advanced Placement Examinations (grades 11 &amp; 12)</li>=0D=\r\n=0A</ol>=0D=0A<p><strong><em>=0D=0A<p align=3D\"center\"><strong><em><a href=\r\n=3D\"/pageview.aspx?id=3D22237#top\"><font size=3D\"1\">back to top</font></a><=\r\n/em></strong><font size=3D\"1\"> =0D=0A<hr />=0D=0A</font></p>=0D=0A</em></st=\r\nrong></p>=0D=0A<h3><a title=3D\"4\" name=3D\"4\"></a>Course Planning</h3>=0D=0A=\r\n<p>Each student in The Beekman School will have an opportunity every semest=\r\ner to discuss his/her courses with an advisor. Specialized courses, usually=\r\n limited to three (3) students, may be formed&nbsp;when requested to meet s=\r\npecific needs (e.g. honors, advanced placement, remedial, and ESL courses).=\r\n If a student requires tutoring, the school will work with parents to help =\r\nset up a tutoring schedule. Tutoring usually occurs after school once or tw=\r\nice a week.</p>=0D=0A<p><strong><em>=0D=0A<p align=3D\"center\"><strong><em><=\r\na href=3D\"/pageview.aspx?id=3D22237#top\"><font size=3D\"1\">back to top</font=\r\n></a></em></strong><font size=3D\"1\"> =0D=0A<hr />=0D=0A</font></p>=0D=0A</e=\r\nm></strong></p>=0D=0A<h3><a title=3D\"5\" name=3D\"5\"></a>Evaluation Reports</=\r\nh3>=0D=0A<p>The faculty writes evaluation reports up to eight times during =\r\nthe academic year in the form of four mid-quarter progress reports and four=\r\n quarterly report cards.</p>=0D=0A<p>Progress reports are issued at the hal=\r\nfway point of each quarter if necessary. The progress reports may include a=\r\n course description, a checklist ranking the student's performance in gener=\r\nal areas, and an early evaluation of how the student is performing.</p>=0D=\r\n=0A<p>Report cards are distributed at the end of each quarter. The letter g=\r\nrade on the report card is based on a variety of assessments used throughou=\r\nt the term. These include: Homework, class participation, lab reports, proj=\r\nects, tests, quizzes, mid-year and final examinations, portfolios, and majo=\r\nr assignments and exhibitions. Some of these are graded with a letter, othe=\r\nrs with a percentage.</p>=0D=0A<p>All comments on report cards are designed=\r\n to be informative, thorough, and personal. The comments may discuss grades=\r\n, offer suggestions for improvement, or discuss specific learning issues.</=\r\np>=0D=0A<p>The grade scale for the evaluation reports is as follows:</p>=0D=\r\n=0A<blockquote>=0D=0A<p>A+ =3D 97-100%</p>=0D=0A<p>A =3D 94-96%</p>=0D=0A<p=\r\n>A- =3D 90-93%</p>=0D=0A<p>B+ =3D 87-89%</p>=0D=0A<p>B =3D 84-86%</p>=0D=0A=\r\n<p>B- =3D 80-83%</p>=0D=0A<p>C+ =3D 77-79%</p>=0D=0A<p>C =3D 74-76%</p>=0D=\r\n=0A<p>C- =3D 70-73%</p>=0D=0A<p>D+ =3D 67-69%</p>=0D=0A<p>D =3D 64-66%</p>=\r\n=0D=0A<p>D- =3D 60-63%</p>=0D=0A<p>F =3D below 60%</p>=0D=0A</blockquote>=\r\n=0D=0A<p><strong><em>=0D=0A<p align=3D\"center\"><strong><em><a href=3D\"/page=\r\nview.aspx?id=3D22237#top\"><font size=3D\"1\">back to top</font></a></em></str=\r\nong></p>=0D=0A</em></strong></p>=0D=0A<hr />=0D=0A<h3><a title=3D\"6\" name=\r\n=3D\"6\"></a>Grades and Honor Roll</h3>=0D=0A<p>The honor roll is tabulated a=\r\nnd posted each marking period. Achievement or progress in specific subject =\r\nareas and/or involvement in specific school activities will be recognized a=\r\nt the graduation ceremony in June. Any student, regardless of grade level, =\r\nwho has performed notably will be honored. Students achieving these honors =\r\nwill have it entered on their permanent school transcript.</p>=0D=0A<p><str=\r\nong><em>=0D=0A<p align=3D\"center\"><strong><em><a href=3D\"/pageview.aspx?id=\r\n=3D22237#top\"><font size=3D\"1\">back to top</font></a></em></strong></p>=0D=\r\n=0A</em></strong></p>=0D=0A<hr />=0D=0A<h3><a title=3D\"7\" name=3D\"7\"></a>Ac=\r\nademic Policy and Procedure Information</h3>=0D=0A<p><br /><strong><em>Home=\r\nwork Policy<br /></em></strong>Students should expect to have homework assi=\r\ngned every day in all subjects. Weekend assignments are given at the discre=\r\ntion of individual teachers. Teachers post daily assignments on the school&=\r\nrsquo;s Website homework page. Students should see their teacher, study hal=\r\nl supervisor, or advisor if they need help or are unable to organize and co=\r\nmplete their work in a reasonable amount of time. Daily homework assignment=\r\ns should take 30-45 minutes per class to complete for freshmen and sophomor=\r\nes and 45 minutes per class for juniors and seniors.</p>=0D=0A<p><em><stron=\r\ng>Assessment<br /></strong></em>A variety of measures, including projects, =\r\nessays, presentations, portfolios, homework assignments, quizzes, and tests=\r\n are used to teach students and assess their progress. All teachers announc=\r\ne dates of tests and due dates of papers and major projects in advance. Stu=\r\ndents should talk to their teachers ahead of time if they need an extension=\r\n on a project or if they need to re-schedule an exam. Generally, if a stude=\r\nnt has three major exams on one day, re-scheduling one of these exams may b=\r\ne possible&mdash; as long as it is done in advance. Re-scheduling an exam o=\r\nn the day of the exam is not permitted.</p>=0D=0A<p><strong><em>Regents and=\r\n Final Exams<br /></em></strong>Regents and final exams take place in Janua=\r\nry and June. An exam schedule and protocol will be mailed to parents two we=\r\neks prior to those scheduled dates.</p>=0D=0A<p><strong><em>Adding/Dropping=\r\n Courses<br /></em></strong>With permission from the Headmaster or Director=\r\n and a parent or legal guardian, a student may drop a course. This course m=\r\nay only be dropped during the first weeks of the semester. If a course is d=\r\nropped after the midpoint of the marking period, the grade remains on the t=\r\nranscript. A new course can be added up to two weeks after the beginning of=\r\n each semester. A variety of elective courses are offered.</p>=0D=0A<p><str=\r\nong><em>=0D=0A<p align=3D\"center\"><strong><em><a href=3D\"/pageview.aspx?id=\r\n=3D22237#top\"><font size=3D\"1\">back to top</font></a></em></strong></p>=0D=\r\n=0A</em></strong></p>=0D=0A<hr />=0D=0A<h3><a title=3D\"8\" name=3D\"8\"></a>Co=\r\nllege Guidance</h3>=0D=0A<p>The College Guidance Counselor advises and supp=\r\norts students with respect to every aspect of the college application proce=\r\nss. This includes:</p>=0D=0A<ul>=0D=0A<li>Conducting individual conferences=\r\n for both students and their parents beginning in the fall of their senior =\r\nyear. </li>=0D=0A<li>Advising students as they identify and prepare for the=\r\n SAT I examination and the particular SAT II Subject Tests and /or AP Exami=\r\nnations that may be necessary for their college applications.</li>=0D=0A<li=\r\n>Alerting students to college fairs in the area.</li>=0D=0A</ul>=0D=0A<p><s=\r\ntrong><em>=0D=0A<p align=3D\"center\"><strong><em><a href=3D\"/pageview.aspx?i=\r\nd=3D22237#top\"><font size=3D\"1\">back to top</font></a></em></strong></p>=0D=\r\n=0A</em></strong></p>=0D=0A<hr />=0D=0A<h3><a title=3D\"9\" name=3D\"9\"></a>Cl=\r\nubs, Activities, and Class Trips</h3>=0D=0A<p>Students and teachers work to=\r\ngether to initiate clubs and programs, organize special assemblies, and spo=\r\nnsor social events. Clubs cover a variety of interests &ndash; environmenta=\r\nl action, outdoor adventure, art galleries, history, film, chess, and more.=\r\n Trips and clubs from recent years include:</p>=0D=0A<ul>=0D=0A<li>Local mu=\r\nseums </li>=0D=0A<li>The Bronx Zoo </li>=0D=0A<li>Theater outings </li>=0D=\r\n=0A<li>Opera </li>=0D=0A<li>Ballet </li>=0D=0A<li>Overnight trips to the Ca=\r\ntskills </li>=0D=0A<li>Week-long international trips </li>=0D=0A<li>Film Cl=\r\nub </li>=0D=0A<li>Literary Journal</li>=0D=0A<li>Yearbook</li>=0D=0A</ul>=\r\n=0D=0A<p><strong><em>=0D=0A<p align=3D\"center\"><strong><em><a href=3D\"/page=\r\nview.aspx?id=3D22237#top\"><font size=3D\"1\">back to top</font></a></em></str=\r\nong></p>=0D=0A</em></strong></p>=0D=0A<hr /></td></tr></table></td></tr><tr=\r\n class=3D\"r4\" id=3D\"r4_22237\"><td colspan=3D\"1\" rowspan=3D\"1\"  width=3D\"480=\r\n\"  id=3D\"c_394274\" ></td><td colspan=3D\"1\" rowspan=3D\"1\" colspan=3D\"2\" rowspan=3D\"1\"  width=3D\"680\"  id=3D\"c=\r\n_394290\" ><div class=3D\"div1\"><div class=3D\"div2\"><h6><a name=3D\"top\" title=\r\n=3D\"top\"></a>Academics&nbsp;:: Course Listings</h6></div></div></td><td col=\r\nspan=3D\"1\" rowspan=3D\"6\"  width=3D\"20\"  id=3D\"c_394292\" ></td></tr><tr clas=\r\ns=3D\"r2\" id=3D\"r2_22239\"><td colspan=3D\"2\" rowspan=3D\"1\"  width=3D\"680\"  al=\r\nign=3D\"left\"  id=3D\"c_394293\" ><div class=3D\"div1\"><div class=3D\"div2\"><h3>=\r\nCourse Credits</h3>=0D=0A<p>Course descriptions are listed for both one-sem=\r\nester and full-year courses. In making selections, it is important to notic=\r\ne the level of the course offered and whether there is a prerequisite. It i=\r\ns necessary to select alternate choices whenever possible because schedulin=\r\ng or enrollment may determine if an elective course will run.</p>=0D=0A<tab=\r\nle style=3D\"background-color: #f2f2f2\" border=3D\"0\" cellspacing=3D\"1\" cellp=\r\nadding=3D\"1\" width=3D\"100%\">=0D=0A<tbody>=0D=0A<tr style=3D\"background-colo=\r\nr: #fbfbfb\" valign=3D\"top\">=0D=0A<td style=3D\"width: 33%;\"><strong><a href=\r\n=3D\"/pageview.aspx?id=3D22239#english\">English</a> <br /></strong>English I=\r\n<br />English II <br />English III <br />English IV <br />Advanced English =\r\n<br
