SCHOOL</h2>=0D=0A<p><strong>Telephone</strong></p>=0D=0A<p>The telep=\r\nhone number for The Beekman School is (212) 755-6666. The telephone number =\r\nfor The Tutoring School is (212) 755-6665. Our office hours are 8:30 a.m. t=\r\no 5:00 p.m., Monday through Thursday, and 8:30 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. on Friday.=\r\n</p>=0D=0A<p><strong>Fax Number</strong></p>=0D=0A<p>The fax number for bot=\r\nh The Beekman School and The Tutoring School is (212) 888-6085.</p>=0D=0A<p=\r\n><strong>E-Mail</strong></p>=0D=0A<p>Each Beekman School and Tutoring Schoo=\r\nl staff member has an e-mail address that follows this pattern: <a href=3D\"=\r\nmailto:FirstnameLastinitial@beekmanschool.org\">FirstnameLastinitial@beekman=\r\nschool.org</a> (Ex.: <a href=3D\"mailto:GeorgeH@beekmanschool.org\">GeorgeH@b=\r\neekmanschool.org</a>)</p>=0D=0A<p><strong>Website</strong></p>=0D=0A<p>The =\r\nschool periodically updates all information found on our Website. In additi=\r\non, each day&rsquo;s homework assignments are posted by 5:00 p.m. Our Websi=\r\nte address is: <a href=3D\"http://www.beekmanschool.org/\">http://www.beekman=\r\nschool.org/</a></p>=0D=0A<p><a href=3D\"/pageview.aspx?id=3D22843#top\">Back =\r\nto Top</a></p>=0D=0A<h2><a title=3D\"2\" name=3D\"2\"></a>BEEKMAN DAILY SCHEDUL=\r\nE</h2>=0D=0A<p><strong>School Schedule and Class Length</strong></p>=0D=0A<=\r\np>The school is open Monday through Friday from 8:15 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. Clas=\r\nses begin at 8:45 a.m. daily. <br />Classes are 45 minutes in length; some =\r\nclasses scheduled at 3:00 p.m. meet for double periods, twice weekly.</p>=\r\n=0D=0A<p><strong>Class Schedule</strong></p>=0D=0A<p>1st Period 8:45<br />2=\r\nnd Period 9:30<br />3rd Period 10:15<br />4th Period 11:00<br />5th Period =\r\n11:45<br />6th Period 12:30 **<br />7th Period 1:20<br />8th Period 2:10<br=\r\n />9th Period 3:00</p>=0D=0A<p>**Classes beginning at 12:30 p.m. or later m=\r\neet Monday through Thursday only. On Friday, all students must attend gym f=\r\nrom 1:00 p.m. to 3:00 p.m. at the Vanderbilt Y.M.C.A. or enroll in a privat=\r\ne exercise activity (see page 15).</p>=0D=0A<p><a href=3D\"/pageview.aspx?id=\r\n=3D22843#top\">Back to Top</a></p>=0D=0A<h2><a title=3D\"3\" name=3D\"3\"></a>AC=\r\nADEMICS AND STUDENT SUPPORT</h2>=0D=0A<p>We at The Beekman School have a ke=\r\nen interest in developing students&rsquo; independent and creative thought,=\r\n willingness to accept intellectual risks and challenges, forming superior =\r\nwork habits and cooperative, positive approaches to learning. While these a=\r\nttributes cannot always be precisely measured and adjusted, we prize them a=\r\nnd work energetically to foster their development. There is no doubt that t=\r\nhe development of these skills brings with them not only a sense of academi=\r\nc achievement but also a feeling of pride and satisfaction.</p>=0D=0A<p><st=\r\nrong>Assessment</strong></p>=0D=0A<p>A variety of measures, including proje=\r\ncts, essays, presentations, portfolios, homework assignments, quizzes, and =\r\ntests are used to teach students and assess their progress. All teachers an=\r\nnounce dates of tests, due dates of <br />papers and major projects in adva=\r\nnce. Students should talk to their teachers ahead of time if they need an e=\r\nxtension on a project or if they need to re-schedule an exam. Generally, if=\r\n a student has three major exams <br />on one day, re-scheduling one of the=\r\nse exams may be possible&mdash; as long as it is done in advance. <br />Re-=\r\nscheduling an exam on the day of the exam is not permitted.</p>=0D=0A<p><st=\r\nrong>Advisory Groups</strong></p>=0D=0A<p>Advisee groups assure that all Be=\r\nekman School and Tutoring School students have at least one adult to suppor=\r\nt their academic and social progress. Each student is assigned a faculty me=\r\nmber as an advisor at the beginning of the year. Typically, each Beekman ad=\r\nvisor has 10 advisees. The advisor oversees all areas of the student&rsquo;=\r\ns growth, offering academic counsel and advocacy. Advisors meet with their =\r\nadvisees as a group during scheduled advisee periods throughout the year. T=\r\nhis &ldquo;town meeting&rdquo; is meant to give students a forum for posing=\r\n questions and making comments and to provide students with important schoo=\r\nl information and quarterly updates.</p>=0D=0A<p><strong>Adding/Dropping Co=\r\nurses</strong></p>=0D=0A<p>With permission from the Headmaster or Director =\r\nand a parent or legal guardian, a student may drop a course. This course ma=\r\ny only be dropped during the first weeks of the semester. If a course is dr=\r\nopped after the midpoint of the marking period, the grade remains on the tr=\r\nanscript. A new course can be added up to two weeks after the beginning of =\r\neach semester. A variety of elective courses are offered during the fall an=\r\nd spring terms.</p>=0D=0A<p><strong>Field Trips</strong></p>=0D=0A<p>As an =\r\naccompaniment to many of our courses, we like to take advantage of the rich=\r\n and varied educational opportunities available in New York City. Field tri=\r\nps are scheduled as the nature of the subject matter in particular courses =\r\ndictates. These class trips are usually mandatory. Most class-related trips=\r\n are held during school hours, <br />and the cost of most trips is included=\r\n in the tuition. Some field trips or voluntary trips involve an additional =\r\npayment. <br />The trip coordinators inform parents in writing of the costs=\r\n and details of each trip. Parents need to give their approval for their so=\r\nn/daughter to go on a field trip by signing and returning a permission slip=\r\n.</p>=0D=0A<p><strong>Homework Policy</strong></p>=0D=0A<p>Students should =\r\nexpect to have homework assigned every day in all subjects. Weekend assignm=\r\nents are given at the discretion of individual teachers. Teachers post dail=\r\ny assignments on the school&rsquo;s Website homework page. Students should =\r\nsee their teachers, study hall supervisor, or advisor if they need help org=\r\nanizing and completing their work in a reasonable amount of time. Daily hom=\r\nework assignments should take 30-45 minutes per class to complete for fresh=\r\nmen and sophomores and 45 minutes per class for juniors and seniors.</p>=0D=\r\n=0A<p><strong>Homework Website</strong></p>=0D=0A<p>Homework assignments ar=\r\ne posted daily on The Beekman School&rsquo;s Website. This Website was desi=\r\ngned for students to utilize if they are absent, if they misplace a homewor=\r\nk assignment, or if parents wish to monitor their child&rsquo;s homework. T=\r\nhe school&rsquo;s Website is: <a href=3D\"http://www.beekmanschool.org/\">htt=\r\np://www.beekmanschool.org/</a>; from there, click on the homework link and =\r\nyou will be able to find the specific dates and assignments you need.</p>=\r\n=0D=0A<p><strong>Study Hall</strong></p>=0D=0A<p>It is important for studen=\r\nts to develop disciplined homework and study habits. For this reason, there=\r\n is a teacher-supervised study hall held every period from 8:45 p.m. to 5:0=\r\n0 p.m. Students may be assigned to a study hall if their academic circumsta=\r\nnces warrant it or if a parent requests it. Attendance is taken during stud=\r\ny hall for all students whose presence is required. Missing a regular study=\r\n hall will result in a one-hour after-school detention.</p>=0D=0A<p><strong=\r\n>Snow Days</strong></p>=0D=0A<p>The Beekman School follows New York City pu=\r\nblic school closings related to inclement weather.</p>=0D=0A<p><strong>The =\r\nTutoring School</strong></p>=0D=0A<p>The Director of The Tutoring School wo=\r\nrks with parents to form special courses usually limited to three (3) stude=\r\nnts (e.g. honors, advanced placement, remedial, and ESL courses). If any st=\r\nudents require tutoring, the Director works with parents to help set up a t=\r\nutoring schedule; tutoring usually occurs after school once or twice<br />a=\r\n week. Please see our Website for more information about this program.</p>=\r\n=0D=0A<p><a href=3D\"/pageview.aspx?id=3D22843#top\">Back to Top</a></p>=0D=\r\n=0A<h2><a title=3D\"4\" name=3D\"4\"></a>HIGH SCHOOL GRADUATION REQUIREMENTS</h=\r\n2>=0D=0A<p>To receive a diploma, a student must earn at least 20 units of c=\r\nredit. One credit is given for each full-year course completed. The followi=\r\nng courses must be completed in order to earn a Beekman School diploma:</p>=\r\n=0D=0A<p>1. Four years of English</p>=0D=0A<p>2. Four years of history/soci=\r\nal sciences, including at least:</p>=0D=0A<ul>=0D=0A<li>One year of World H=\r\nistory</li>=0D=0A<li>One year of United States History</li>=0D=0A<li>One se=\r\nmester of U. S. Government</li>=0D=0A<li>One semester of Economics</li>=0D=\r\n=0A</ul>=0D=0A<p>3. Three years of mathematics, including:</p>=0D=0A<ul>=0D=\r\n=0A<li>One year of Algebra</li>=0D=0A<li>One year of Geometry </li>=0D=0A</=\r\nul>=0D=0A<p>4. Three years of science, including: One year that consists of=\r\n at least 20 hours of laboratory time</p>=0D=0A<p>5. Two years of the same =\r\nforeign language</p>=0D=0A<p>6. One year of visual arts, music, dance or th=\r\neatre</p>=0D=0A<p>7. One semester of health</p>=0D=0A<p>8. One semester of =\r\ncomputer technology</p>=0D=0A<p>9. Electives: Two years (or four semesters)=\r\n</p>=0D=0A<p>Physical Education is mandatory for all full-time Beekman Scho=\r\nol and Tutoring School students. These credits are not included in the requ=\r\nired 20 units.</p>=0D=0A<p>In addition to the course requirements, the foll=\r\nowing five Regents exams must be passed with a minimum score of 65% in orde=\r\nr to receive a Beekman School diploma:&nbsp;</p>=0D=0A<ol>=0D=0A<li>Compreh=\r\nensive English</li>=0D=0A<li>Global History &amp; Geography</li>=0D=0A<li>U=\r\nnited States History &amp; Government</li>=0D=0A<li>Mathematics A or Sequen=\r\ntial Mathematics I and Sequential Mathematics II</li>=0D=0A<li>Living Envir=\r\nonment (Science)</li>=0D=0A</ol>=0D=0A<p>&nbsp;</p>=0D=0A<p><a href=3D\"/pag=\r\neview.aspx?id=3D22843#top\">Back to Top</a></p>=0D=0A<h2><a title=3D\"5\" name=\r\n=3D\"5\"></a>BEEKMAN SCHOOL CODE AND POLICIES</h2>=0D=0A<p>We are proud of ou=\r\nr school community. In order to maintain a healthy learning environment and=\r\n to insure its steady growth and progress, individuals within our community=\r\n must agree to certain tenets rooted in mutual respect. <br />In order for =\r\na Beekman student to develop a sense of pride in self, work, and school, <b=\r\nr />the following code of ethics and behavior will be applied to every stud=\r\nent. Our code is no more and no less than what would be required of any ind=\r\nividual who lives and works in a group environment.</p>=0D=0A<p><strong>Whi=\r\nle I attend The Beekman School/The Tutoring School I agree that:</strong></=\r\np>=0D=0A<ol>=0D=0A<li><strong>I will respect the rights of everyone in The =\r\nBeekman School/The Tutoring School comm</strong>unity, <br />as I expect ot=\r\nhers to respect my rights. Rude behavior or offensive language in dealing w=\r\nith students, faculty, or staff will not be tolerated and can result in exp=\r\nulsion. Students involved in any act of physical violence will be immediate=\r\nly withdrawn.</li>=0D=0A<li><strong>I will behave in a respectful way towar=\r\nd school and community property.</strong></li>=0D=0A<li><strong>I will unde=\r\nrstand that eating and drinking</strong> (other than bottled water) anywher=\r\ne above the first floor, or in The Tutoring School, is not permitted.</li>=\r\n=0D=0A<li><strong>I&nbsp;will not litter anywhere in the school or its imme=\r\ndiate environs.</strong></li>=0D=0A<li><strong>I will not graffiti on or ne=\r\nar school property.<br /></strong><em>A student who writes in graffiti on s=\r\nchool property will be responsible for cleaning his/her writing from the ar=\r\nea. A second violation will result in cleaning additional areas in the scho=\r\nol, or will have some other appropriate consequence. Continued defacing of =\r\nthe school will result in suspension or expulsion.</em></li>=0D=0A<li><stro=\r\nng>I will obey garden regulations.</strong> I recognize that the garden is =\r\nopen to all students who have a free period or a lunch period.<br /><em>I u=\r\nnderstand that if I jeopardize any student&rsquo;s rights in the garden by =\r\nbehaving in a loud or disruptive manner, I will be banned from the garden f=\r\nor an indeterminate amount of time.<br /><br />I understand that if I abuse=\r\n the school or the garden by causing any physical damage I will be financia=\r\nlly responsible for its repair or replacement.</em></li>=0D=0A<li><strong>I=\r\n will not stand, sit, rest, or pause anywhere on 50th Street between Second=\r\n and Third Avenues</strong> or in front of the high rises on the southeast =\r\nand northeast corners of Third Avenue at any time or for any reason. Studen=\r\nts who are seen standing or sitting will be suspended or assigned detention=\r\n or community service. Continued violation of this policy may result in exp=\r\nulsion.</li>=0D=0A<li><strong>I will remind my friends from other schools n=\r\not to wait for me anywhere on the block or corners.</strong></li>=0D=0A<li>=\r\n<strong>I will not use a personal stereo device, cell phone, or beeper abov=\r\ne or below the main floor.<br /></strong><em>On the main floor and in the g=\r\narden, I may use a personal stereo as long as others do not hear it. A beep=\r\ner or cell phone may be used as long as it does not disturb others. A stude=\r\nnt who uses a personal stereo, cell phone or beeper above the main floor wi=\r\nll have it confiscated and it will not be returned until the end of the sch=\r\nool day.</em></li>=0D=0A<li><strong>I will not cheat on examinations.<br />=\r\n</strong><em>Cheating on an examination will result in an automatic zero, a=\r\ns well as academic probation. Expulsion from school may also occur.</em></l=\r\ni>=0D=0A<li><strong>I will not plagiarize.<br /></strong><em>Plagiarizing w=\r\nill result in an automatic zero, as well as academic probation. Expulsion f=\r\nrom school may occur.</em></li>=0D=0A<li><strong>I will be punctual to clas=\r\nses.<br /></strong><em>Tardiness may result in an absence from the class as=\r\n well as a one-hour, after school detention. Detention is served Monday thr=\r\nough Thursday, from 4:00 p.m. to 5:00 p.m.</em></li>=0D=0A<li><strong>I wil=\r\nl dress in an appropriate manner.<br /></strong><em>Clothing that is offens=\r\nive or provocative, or sunglasses or hats that block eye contact are not to=\r\n be worn in the classroom.</em></li>=0D=0A<li><strong>I understand that awa=\r\nrds for achievement or progress and certificates</strong> for involvement i=\r\nn specific school activities will be bestowed at our graduation ceremony to=\r\n all students, regardless of grade level, who have demonstrated notable per=\r\nformance in any given area. This honor will be noted on the transcript that=\r\n follows me through high school and on to college.</li>=0D=0A<li><strong>I =\r\nunderstand that if the school is to be closed due to any emergency situatio=\r\nn</strong>,&nbsp;a notice will be posted on the school's website: <a href=\r\n=3D\"http://www.beekmanschool.org\">http://www.beekmanschool.org</a> <em><str=\r\nong>This is a rare event.</strong></em> I am expected to show up for school=\r\n every day, regardless of weather conditions, unless I have been notified t=\r\nhat the school has been closed. However, if the New York City&nbsp; public =\r\nschools are closed due to weather or any emergency, then it is understood t=\r\nhat The Beekman School is also closed. Listen to local radio or TV stations=\r\n for updates.&nbsp;</li>=0D=0A<li><strong>Substance Abuse Policy (updated F=\r\neb. 09)</strong>&nbsp;<br />As a Beekman School/Tutoring School student, I =\r\nacknowledge that the school believes strongly in its obligation to educate =\r\nand shape the mind and strengthen the character of its students.&nbsp; The =\r\nschool further believes that learning cannot take place when students are u=\r\nnder the influence of drugs/alcohol.&nbsp; Therefore, in order to achieve o=\r\nur educational goals and objectives, the following steps will be taken in r=\r\nesponse to any suspected or proven drug/alcohol offense:<br /><br />We inte=\r\nnd to uphold the law.&nbsp; Any student found in possession of drugs will b=\r\ne reported to the police and sent home immediately.&nbsp; Any student found=\r\n with drug paraphernalia will be sent home immediately.&nbsp; Before either=\r\n student can return to classes, an evaluation by a school-approved drug/alc=\r\nohol professional counselor will be required.&nbsp; The student is responsi=\r\nble for work missed during his/her suspension; however, he/she will not rec=\r\neive full-credit for work assigned during the suspension.&nbsp; If the stud=\r\nent is permitted to return to classes, it may be necessary to restrict the =\r\nprivileges of the student.&nbsp; In order to ensure that the school is drug=\r\n-free, all students will be subject to a search at any time while they are =\r\non school premises or its environs.&nbsp; In addition, the school retains o=\r\nwnership of all student lockers and maintains its right of access.&nbsp; Yo=\r\nur attendance in our school acknowledges your agreement/compliance with thi=\r\ns policy.<br /><br />Any student who appears impaired will be sent home imm=\r\nediately and his/her parents will be notified.&nbsp; An evaluation by a sch=\r\nool-approved drug/alcohol professional counselor will be required before th=\r\ne student can return to classes.&nbsp; The student is responsible for work =\r\nmissed during his/her suspension; however, he/she will not receive full-cre=\r\ndit for work assigned during the suspension.&nbsp; If the student returns t=\r\no classes, it may be necessary to restrict the privileges of the student.<b=\r\nr /><br />A second drug/alcohol offense will result in the student's perman=\r\nent withdrawal from school until a drug/alcohol treatment program is comple=\r\nted.&nbsp; Once a professional counselor and the Beekman faculty deem it ap=\r\npropriate, the student may return to school.<br /><br />Should any student =\r\nwish to discuss a drug- or alcohol-related problem with a member of the fac=\r\nulty, the administration will try to help the student stay in school while =\r\narranging for proper outside assessment and care.&nbsp; All students are en=\r\ncouraged to seek the support of any adult in The Beekman School or The Tuto=\r\nring School.</li>=0D=0A<li>=0D=0A<p><strong>Harassment Policy</strong><br /=\r\n>It is the right of every person who comes to The Beekman School to enjoy f=\r\nreedom from harassment. Harassment is the persistent annoyance of another i=\r\nndividual. Any student who harasses and/or threatens any member of the scho=\r\nol community will be subject to disciplinary action.</p>=0D=0A</li>=0D=0A<l=\r\ni>=0D=0A<p><strong>Sexual Harassment</strong><br />Legal Definition: Sexual=\r\n harassment is a precisely defined illegal form of differential treatment b=\r\nased on gender. Legally, it is described as unwelcome sexual favors and oth=\r\ner verbal or physical conduct of a sexual nature when any of the following =\r\nconditions exist:</p>=0D=0A</li>=0D=0A</ol>=0D=0A<ul>=0D=0A<li>Submission t=\r\no such conduct is made either explicitly or implicitly a term or condition =\r\nof an individual&rsquo;s employment, education or welfare<br /><strong><em>=\r\nor</em></strong></li>=0D=0A<li>Submission or rejection of such conduct by a=\r\nn individual is used as the basis for employment or education decisions aff=\r\necting such individuals<br /><strong><em>or</em></strong></li>=0D=0A<li>Suc=\r\nh conduct has the purpose or effects of creating an intimidating, hostile, =\r\nor offensive educational or employment environment.</li>=0D=0A</ul>=0D=0A<p=\r\n>Sexual harassment can originate from a person of either sex against a pers=\r\non of the opposite or same sex. Sexual harassment may occur from student-to=\r\n-student, from staff-to-student, from student-to-staff. Prohibited conduct =\r\ncan be verbal, non-verbal, or physical (the latter may qualify as criminal =\r\nsexual assault).</p>=0D=0A<p>Behavior shall be considered unwelcome and unw=\r\nanted if the student did not initiate, request, or invite such conduct or c=\r\nommunication and/or regarded such conduct or communication as undesirable o=\r\nr offensive.</p>=0D=0A<p><a href=3D\"/pageview.aspx?id=3D22843#top\">Back to =\r\nTop</a></p>=0D=0A<h2><a title=3D\"6\" name=3D\"6\"></a>ATTENDANCE POLICY</h2>=\r\n=0D=0A<p>We consider attendance to be vital in order to attain and maintain=\r\n acceptable grades in any course. Students are expected to attend all class=\r\nes each day. Occasionally, students are absent or need to leave school earl=\r\ny.</p>=0D=0A<p>Students and parents should note that there is a limit to th=\r\ne number of classes any student can miss if he/she wishes to receive credit=\r\n for a course. The Beekman School/The Tutoring School allows any student to=\r\n miss a total of sixteen class periods in each yearlong course. This number=\r\n includes all absence/sick days, minutes late, if any, and any absences due=\r\n to lateness or cuts. In a semester course, this limit is eight absences pe=\r\nr course. If a student exceeds this limit and still passes the class, no ac=\r\nademic credit will be given, regardless of the grade, until one hour of com=\r\nmunity service for each excessive absence has been completed.</p>=0D=0A<p><=\r\nstrong>Absences</strong></p>=0D=0A<p>Parents are expected to notify the sch=\r\nool immediately if their child will not be in attendance.</p>=0D=0A<p><stro=\r\nng>Lateness</strong></p>=0D=0A<p>Students will not be admitted into a class=\r\nroom late. Students are expected to be in the classroom when the second bel=\r\nl rings. Should a student arrive after the bell rings, the teacher will rec=\r\nord the absence and a one-hour after-school detention will be given. If the=\r\nre is a legitimate reason why the student is late, parents may contact the =\r\nschool and excuse the lateness, thereby eliminating the after-school detent=\r\nion.</p>=0D=0A<p><strong>Cuts</strong></p>=0D=0A<p>If a student misses a cl=\r\nass without a valid excuse, he/she will be given a detention. This is calle=\r\nd a cut and will be added to the student's yearly attendance total. Any stu=\r\ndent who accumulates four cuts during a marking period may be placed on an =\r\nattendance probation. <strong>If the student accumulates five (5) cuts or m=\r\nore, he/she may be expelled.</strong></p>=0D=0A<p><strong>Detention</strong=\r\n></p>=0D=0A<ol>=0D=0A<li>Detention is held Monday through Thursday from 4:0=\r\n0 p.m. to 5:00 p.m.</li>=0D=0A<li>A student may receive detention for tardi=\r\nness, coming to class unprepared, using inappropriate language, or for infr=\r\ningement of general classroom decorum. </li>=0D=0A<li>If a student is given=\r\n a detention, attendance from 4:00 to 5:00 p.m. is mandatory that day or th=\r\ne next. If a student does not serve detention during this time period on a =\r\nday his/her name is posted on the detention list, then additional detention=\r\ns will accrue; a missed detention period results in receiving another deten=\r\ntion. </li>=0D=0A<li>If a student accrues more than ten detentions, he or s=\r\nhe will be placed on a detention probation.<br /></li>=0D=0A</ol>=0D=0A<p><=\r\nstrong>Attendance Requirement</strong></p>=0D=0A<p>The school will allow a =\r\nstudent to \"buy back\" a maximum of four excessive absences in each full-yea=\r\nr course and two absences in a semester course. This \"buy back\" is accompli=\r\nshed by having the student stay in school and do additional coursework or s=\r\ntudy during mid-term and final exam weeks only. In order to fulfill this re=\r\nquirement, students need to stay in school 90 minutes for each 45-minute cl=\r\nass missed; this is to be done ONLY during our final exam period and ONLY w=\r\nith the approval of the administration.</p>=0D=0A<p><strong>If a student ha=\r\ns more than four classes that need to be made up, there are two options:</s=\r\ntrong></p>=0D=0A<ol>=0D=0A<li>Students may enroll in a school-approved comm=\r\nunity service program. Upon completion of the required amount of volunteer/=\r\ncommunity service hours, we require a letter on the non-profit foundation&r=\r\nsquo;s letterhead testifying to the student&rsquo;s activities and the date=\r\ns and hours served.<br /><strong><em>OR</em></strong></li>=0D=0A<li>Student=\r\ns must attend a &ldquo;mini-session&rdquo; which begins the week immediatel=\r\ny following our graduation ceremony. Students must make up only the number =\r\nof excessive absences that they have accumulated, no more and no less. Plea=\r\nse be advised, since the school year officially ends at graduation, there i=\r\ns a fee for the &ldquo;mini-session&rdquo; in addition to the tuition for t=\r\nhe academic year. Students will be given extra coursework to complete durin=\r\ng this period.</li>=0D=0A</ol>=0D=0A<p><strong>Academic credit for a course=\r\n will be granted after successful completion of the following two (2) requi=\r\nrements:</strong></p>=0D=0A<ol>=0D=0A<li>A passing grade of 60% or better<b=\r\nr /><strong><em>AND</em></strong></li>=0D=0A<li>A final attendance record n=\r\not exceeding sixteen class periods missed per year course, eight per semest=\r\ner course.</li>=0D=0A</ol>=0D=0A<p><strong>Community Service</strong></p>=\r\n=0D=0A<p>Community service hours are issued for excessive absences, unserve=\r\nd detentions at the end of the school year, and for standing on E 50th St b=\r\netween 2nd and 3rd Aves. Parents and guardians will receive an attendance r=\r\neport at the end of each semester that summarizes students' current communi=\r\nty service hour balance. In order to count, service must be unpaid and thro=\r\nugh a non-profit organization. We must receive a letter stating hours worke=\r\nd and tasks performed on letterhead with a signature in order for the work =\r\nto be processed. These can be faxed or sent to the school. We also encourag=\r\ne students who do not owe hours to experience community service.</p>=0D=0A<=\r\np>Some organizations require a form from the school, which can be found <a =\r\nhref=3D\"http://centralpt.com/upload/372/14194_Community_Service_Form.doc\" t=\r\narget=3D\"_blank\">here</a>.</p>=0D=0A<p>For a list of organizations where st=\r\nudents have served in the past, click <a href=3D\"http://centralpt.com/uploa=\r\nd/372/14195_community_service_suggestions.pdf\" target=3D\"_blank\">here</a>.<=\r\n/p>=0D=0A<p>If you have additional questions or concerns regarding attendan=\r\nce or community service, please contact <a href=3D\"mailto:attendance@beekma=\r\nnschool.org\">attendance@beekmanschool.org</a></p>=0D=0A<p>&nbsp;</p>=0D=0A<=\r\np><a href=3D\"/pageview.aspx?id=3D22843#top\">Back to Top</a></p>=0D=0A<h2><a=\r\n title=3D\"7\" name=3D\"7\"></a>GUIDELINES FOR ACADEMIC AND BEHAVIORAL STANDARD=\r\nS</h2>=0D=0A<p>The guidelines for academic and behavioral probation at The =\r\nBeekman School or The Tutoring School are similar to its guidelines for acc=\r\neptance. Since our probation guidelines are flexible and completely non-dis=\r\ncriminatory, we feel that they are broad enough to accommodate students wit=\r\nh varying abilities and backgrounds.</p>=0D=0A<p>Student progress is evalua=\r\nted at faculty meetings that occur every Friday afternoon. The terms of a s=\r\ntudent&rsquo;s probation are based upon these evaluations and discussions. =\r\nAfter a student has been attending school long <br />enough to exhibit an u=\r\nnacceptable pattern of under-achievement, he or she may be placed on an aca=\r\ndemic probation. This is done with the consent of a majority of the full-ti=\r\nme faculty. The decision to place a student on academic or behavioral proba=\r\ntion is reached only after arduous, thorough consideration and debate. Such=\r\n a <br />serious decision has never been prejudicial or arbitrary, nor does=\r\n it reflect the opinion of one or two members of the group or headmaster.</=\r\np>=0D=0A<p>Probation guidelines are carefully tailored to individual studen=\r\nts. The faculty requires only what can be reasonably accomplished by that p=\r\narticular individual; they do not ask the impossible. The requirements for =\r\nthe probation are specifically outlined in a letter and sent to the parents=\r\n or guardian of that student. Once placed on probation, the student is not =\r\npermitted to drop any course after one week past the midpoint of any markin=\r\ng period. When a student is asked to leave The Beekman School or The Tutori=\r\nng School because he/she has been unable or unwilling to meet the obligatio=\r\nns set forth in the probation, the school makes every effort to assist him =\r\nor her in finding a more appropriate placement.</p>=0D=0A<p>The decision of=\r\n the faculty or administration to withdraw a student from The Beekman Schoo=\r\nl or The Tutoring School is so serious that it has never been reached witho=\r\nut exhaustive consideration. The faculty is open to reconsidering expulsion=\r\n decisions, but only on the basis of reasonable appeal and NEVER in respons=\r\ne to parental threats or coercion. Beekman reserves the right, as an indepe=\r\nndent organization, to set the academic and behavioral standards for its di=\r\nverse student population.</p>=0D=0A<p><a href=3D\"/pageview.aspx?id=3D22843#=\r\ntop\">Back to Top</a></p>=0D=0A<h2><a title=3D\"8\" name=3D\"8\"></a>HEALTH POLI=\r\nCY</h2>=0D=0A<p><strong>Physical Exam</strong></p>=0D=0A<p>The Beekman Scho=\r\nol/The Tutoring School suggests that all students have a yearly physical ex=\r\nam. Prior to admission, each child must have a physical examination by a ph=\r\nysician and must submit the forms found on pages 16 and 17 which request in=\r\nformation about past and present medical conditions, medication taken, and =\r\ndates of immunizations for diphtheria, polio, measles, rubella, mumps, teta=\r\nnus, and tuberculosis (results of tuberculin test).</p>=0D=0A<p><strong>Eme=\r\nrgency Prodedures</strong></p>=0D=0A<p>Prior to admission, the emergency fo=\r\nrm on page 17 must be completed which informs us of any special procedures =\r\nor treatment the school should follow. In the event of an emergency, if a p=\r\narent, guardian or other person having legal custody cannot be contacted, t=\r\nhe headmaster shall be responsible for insuring that first aid is administe=\r\nred and/or the instructions on the medical form are followed. If necessary,=\r\n emergency medical care will be secured from Bellevue Hospital located at F=\r\nirst Avenue and 27th Street, New York, NY. The emergency room number is (21=\r\n2) 562-3025.</p>=0D=0A<p>In the event an ambulance is necessary, the headma=\r\nster or other staff member will call Police/Fire/Ambulance at Bellevue Hosp=\r\nital, or dial 911. The headmaster or staff member will accompany the child =\r\nin the ambulance and will be responsible for bringing the child&rsquo;s med=\r\nical records to the hospital.</p>=0D=0A<p>In the event of an emergency evac=\r\nuation, we will receive directions from the local police department. Studen=\r\nts will be divided into supervised groups according to their classes at the=\r\n time of the evacuation. If a student does not have a class at that time he=\r\n/she will be under the supervision of the headmaster. Groups will proceed t=\r\no a specific meeting location. Once the group is safely at the destination,=\r\n the teacher will call parents/guardians to inform them of the evacuation.<=\r\n/p>=0D=0A<p><strong>Symptoms of Illness</strong></p>=0D=0A<p>If a child sho=\r\nuld have or should develop symptoms of illness, he/she shall be provided wi=\r\nth a place to rest quietly, under observation, until he/she is seen by a ph=\r\nysician or leaves school.</p>=0D=0A<p><strong>Minimilazation of Infection</=\r\nstrong></p>=0D=0A<p>The faculty will be instructed in the recognition of co=\r\nmmon infectious diseases and illnesses such as strep throat, chicken pox, o=\r\nr conjunctivitis. Any student exhibiting symptoms of an infectious disease =\r\nwill be sent home.</p>=0D=0A<p><strong>Daily Health Check</strong></p>=0D=\r\n=0A<p>All cases of suspected child abuse must be reported. Likewise, should=\r\n a student&rsquo;s general physical condition or health seem to deteriorate=\r\n, teachers will notify the headmaster and this may result in notification o=\r\nf the proper authorities.</p>=0D=0A<p><strong>Medication</strong></p>=0D=0A=\r\n<p>Under no circumstances shall any child be administered any medication, p=\r\nrescription, variation in diet, or other remedy/treatment, and no special m=\r\nedical procedures shall be carried out, except with the written consent of =\r\nthe parent or guardian.</p>=0D=0A<p><a href=3D\"/pageview.aspx?id=3D22843#to=\r\np\">Back to Top</a></p>=0D=0A<h2><a title=3D\"9\" name=3D\"9\"></a>PHYSICAL EDUC=\r\nATION PROGRAM</h2>=0D=0A<p>In accordance with the New York State physical e=\r\nducation mandate for secondary schools, all students must participate in th=\r\ne following: two hours per week of an organized athletic activity. The only=\r\n exemption to a physical education program is medical. Your personal physic=\r\nian must send a letter to the school verifying the nature, necessity, and d=\r\nuration of the exemption.</p>=0D=0A<p><strong>The physical education regula=\r\ntion can be fulfilled in one of the following two ways:</strong></p>=0D=0A<=\r\nh3>Program 1</h3>=0D=0A<p>Participation in The Beekman School gym program e=\r\nach Friday from 1:00 p.m. to 3:00 p.m. at the Vanderbilt Y.M.C.A., 224 East=\r\n 47th Street, New York, NY, (212) 756-9600. The program begins with a 30- t=\r\no 45- minute aerobic class followed by supervised weight training and cardi=\r\novascular exercise, lap swimming, or a variety of other athletic activities=\r\n throughout the year. Students must wear appropriate clothing and bring a l=\r\nock for the changing-room lockers.</p>=0D=0A<p>An unexcused absence from gy=\r\nm will result in receiving two detentions, as well as two cuts.</p>=0D=0A<h=\r\n3>Program 2</h3>=0D=0A<p>An Individual Physical Education Program that is a=\r\nrranged by parents, is approved by the school administration, and supervise=\r\nd and documented by an instructor in the elected activity. Activities might=\r\n include dance, martial arts, aerobics, yoga, tennis, swimming, etc. This i=\r\ns an equivalency program and, in each case, the state requirement of two ho=\r\nurs per week must be met.</p>=0D=0A<p>Should you choose Program 2 (Individu=\r\nal), the approval form on the following page must be on file at school. <br=\r\n />Until such time, you must remain in Program 1.</p>=0D=0A<p><strong>NOTE:=\r\n</strong> Failure to complete a physical education program may delay gradua=\r\ntion and/or receipt of a student&rsquo;s diploma.</p>=0D=0A<p><a href=3D\"/p=\r\nageview.aspx?id=3D22843#top\">Back to Top</a></p></div></div></td></tr><tr c=\r\nlass=3D\"r3\" id=3D\"r3_22843\"><td colspan=3D\"1\" rowspan=3D\"1\"  width=3D\"640\" =\r\n
